column5: With the mild weather,decided to get the boat out.Spent the day catching walleye and pike. A little work on the ramp to launch the boat. Broke a tail light on ice when we put the boat in. Forgot the landing net,but we manage to land a some nice fish.
Awesome job in some less than favourable conditions Steve!
Nice fish....  That second pic is sweet
Nice walleye. Wow. I sure would like to hear where in the river u got those. If I were u I would not tell me though:)

now that is some serious skills!!!!!  i'm very impressed.  i know the best guides on the river know where the walleye are, but to put a few of them in the boat, in those conditions....  you sir know your stuff!!!!  see you on the river - the brown river - soon!
Some impressive fish there boyz, well done for sure !!
Wow, those are some tanks. Nicely done.
Awesome. Neat to see a winter walleye softwater report from Niagara.
Way to go Steve. Looks like you were jiggin those babbys. Any Perch in the mix? Didn't see you at the Awards Night.

Way to go Steve. Looks like you were jiggin those babbys. Any Perch in the mix? Didn't see you at the Awards Night. Jigs and minnows. No perch.4 pike .I had to work nights so I did not make it to the awards night.
Excellent fish.  There sure aren't many small walleye in there
Wow, very nice pickereyes there Steve!  Pete
Soft water Walleye in February. Can hardly wait till this ice and snow start to move on so I can scratch that open water itch again. Nicely done.
Awesome fishing trip boys !!! Some nice Walters there for sure !!!!! In febuary no less !!!! Tight-lines !!! Thanks for sharing ....
nice fish! you guys are crazy haha
Some very impressive fish!!  Good stuff!
I think the Niagara has the biggest of everything!  Those are some nice 'eyes!
Theres some dedication!   No judgement, just wondering if you eat those slobs from there.   Bacon wrapped and barbecued!

Theres some dedication!   No judgement, just wondering if you eat those slobs from there.   Bacon wrapped and barbecued! I will eat the smaller ones some times,but there is a good chance for a 15lb plus fish this time of year .Walleye closes at the end of  month on the Niagara.
wow.....braver than I am....hahahaha  Nice fish guys!!!!
Beautiful fish:)
great pictures and the fish aren't bad looking fish either
Amazing.  Lower or Upper?
